newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: One, three and six month Saudi t-bill yields rise.
newsitem.headline: One, three and six month Saudi t-bill yields rise.

text.p: Yields climbed at this week's Saudi Arabian Monetary Agency offering of treasury bills worth three billion riyals, a banker said on Monday.

The yield on 28-day bills rose to 5.4850 percent from 5.3837 a week ago and the rate on 91-day paper climbed to 5.6028 from 5.5075 percent. The yield on 182-day bills increased to 5.7978 percent from 5.6261.
One-month interbank deposits were quoted at 5-5/8, 1/2 percent, three months were at 5-3/4, 5/8 percent and six months were at 5-15/16, 13/16 percent.
